item.name: "Ioan Alexandru Brătescu-Voinești" public primary school
item.description:
In my 4th year of primary school I achieved the highest grade in county round of the Mathematics Olympics.
During middle school I casually attended the Mathematics Olympics with good county round results but never qualified for the Romanian National Team.
I was elected class president 3 years running due to my exceptional results and organisational abilities and capacity to get along with a wide range of people across all ages and professions.

item.name: "Ienăchiță Văcărescu National College" public high school
item.description:
For the first 2 years of high school I reprised my role as class president and my hobby of attending the county round of olympics, this time the C++ Informatics Olympics. 
During my final years I took a step down to immerse myself in other topics like Intelligence, Psychology, Technology and Literature.
I passed the 2008 Romanian Baccalaureate with a 91/100 average score, notable 100/100 on the written Romanian Language and Literature exam.

item.name: "Romanian-American University" private university
item.description:
Studying Law was very rewarding on a personal level and while I dropped out as a freshman that experience is what fueled my involvement into local politics and later on software licensing and business management.
Learning the history of laws and ethics is something I later on developed into a hobby.
